intro: Weingartia westii, commonly known as the Westii cactus, is a species of flowering plant in the Cactaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. This plant is characterized by its compact, globular shape and spiny, ribbed stems. It produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Weingartia westii is well adapted to dry environments, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
